question: What does it look like I'm doing? I'm killing Iraqis. At-at-at-at-at. At-at- at-at--
answer: Could you stop, please. You're giving me a headache.

question: A headache?
answer: Yeah, a headache. My head hurts. You're making me uncomfortable.

question: I'm making you uncomfortable. Baking away in a desert in the middle of nowhere facing three-hundred-thousand screaming Iraqis with nerve gas scud missiles, that doesn't bother you. But me making a little noise is driving you out of your skull.
answer: Yes. Yes. That's exactly it. Yes.

question: Okay. At-at-at-at-at.
answer: Knock it off!

question: Don't get pissed at me, just 'cause I want to be ready when this war starts.
answer: Ready for what? What are you supposed to be doing?

question: I told you, I'm shooting Iraqis.
answer: No you're not. The Iraqis are that way. Those are our troops you're shooting at. You know what? I think you got Schwarzkopf. You did! You got the General right in the ass. Now that's good shooting.

question: Blow me.
answer: Another month in this desert and I might just.

question: When do you ever point the soles of your feet at people?
answer: I'm saying don't do it accidently.

question: Oh yeah. Accidently. I'm sorry. My foot accidently jumped up in the air where you could see the bottom of it. I hate it when that happens.
answer: Come on. You're going to get us in trouble.

question: It was an accident. You saw it was an accident.
answer: I'm just trying to help you guys out. It doesn't hurt to know something about Saudi Arabia.

question: Hey, Jaeger. Why don't you try this
answer: What does that mean?

question: Don't shoot me, I'm friendly. You can use that when you surrender.
answer: How do you say "Come here, baby. I'm horny." I can use that now.

question: Ask him what it is.
answer: He says it's a box.

question: Yeah, you're funny.
answer: It's a puzzle box. If you can figure out how to open it there's supposed to be a treasure inside.

question: For real? A treasure?
answer: Oh, man, you're not going to fall for that.

question: There might be something in there.
answer: Yeah, the deed to the Brooklyn bridge.

question: You get it yet?
answer: Naw, nothing.

question: You will. You'll get it.
answer: I'll show Epps. He'll be sorry when I get this thing open.

question: You really think there's a treasure inside?
answer: I don't care if there's a lump of coal in here. I just want to be able to rub Epps' face in it when I crack this thing.

question: Jaeger?
answer: What?

question: You know the fifteenth is the deadline for the Iraqis to get out of Kuwait.
answer: Yeah. So?

question: That's in two days.
answer: Like I said; so?

question: They're cancelling all leaves, all passes. No more drills. We stand at full ready starting--
answer: What's your point, Wes? You have a point?

question: We're going to war, aren't we. If they're doing all that it must mean we're going to war.
answer: It doesn't mean anything.

question: Why would they do all that if we weren't?
answer: Okay, so we're going to war. We're supposed to go to war. We're soldiers, that's what we do. The guns, the tanks, the planes; you're just now getting the hint we're in the war business?

question: Jaeger?
answer: What!?

question: You ever think about dying?
answer: Come on, man. I almost had this thing open.

question: You ever think about it? You ever worry?
answer: The only thing I worry about is how much Iraqi ass I'm going to be able to kick before this whole thing is over. The only people who I've got anything to worry about are the poor, dumb camel jockeys who don't know enough to get out of the way when I come rolling at them; an M-16 in each hand, and a grenade between my teeth. Now if you'll excuse me, soldier, I'd like to get back to my box. I've got a treasure to find.

question: At-at-at-at-at.
answer: Will you knock it off! Damn, man. You're going to annoy the Iraqis into submission.

question: This is stupid. It's going on a month now. How long are they going to let the Air Force piss on those bastards? They can bomb them all they want, Saddam ain't going anywhere without a ground assault. What the hell is the army waiting for?
answer: Why you in such a hurry to get to shooting?

question: You know what, Wes? If you get a note from your mommy they might excuse you from the war.
answer: You all want to lay off? God. I hope the Iraqis shoot me; put me out of my misery.

question: OH MY GOD!
answer: What!? What!?

question: I did it! I got the box open.
answer: You almost got yourself shot, that's what you did.

question: It's a container. Break the seal.
answer: Go on, man.

question: Paper.
answer: It's a fortune box.

question: What's it say?
answer: Help, I'm being held prisoner in a puzzle box factory.

question: A map map. That shouldn't be too hard to read. Iraq is the pink thing.
answer: I could use some recon photos too.

question: Planning on going to war all by your lonesome?
answer: Just...want to be ready when we do.

question: Ready for what? Sight-seeing?
answer: The photos. Some good ones.

question: They're all good ones. Satellites we've got can snap a shot of the boil on Saddam's ass.
answer: Saddam's got a boil on his ass? I don't know. Thanks, man. Appreciate it.

question: Yeah. You figure out how to win the war be sure to let us know.
answer: No that's okay. I'm gonna...I'm doing some...

question: With...with millions. Millions of dollars.
answer: What are you talking about? Don't even. You're not going to show me that tired map.

question: Wait. Wait.
answer: I think you've got some issues to deal with. Really, when we get out of here I'm pretty sure it's shrink time for you.

question: Just listen to me! I've been doing some reading. In the Sixteenth century this region was invaded by the Turks. It became part of the Ottoman empire. When the Turks rolled in they raped, they pillaged, the usual stuff. Anybody who had anything wanted to hide it from these bastards. They buried their treasures, drew maps, and hid the maps in puzzle boxes. I read about this, man. I read about it.
answer: Wellllll, if you read it it must be true. Was it in the Star, or the Enquirer?

question: What we're doing is kicking ass. For God's sake they got Iraqis surrendering to news crews. The war is over. We've just got to keep shooting people 'cause the army spent all this money, and we've got to put on a show for the taxpayers.
answer: You're not saying what I think you're saying. I can't believe you're even thinking it.

question: It's right here. This region; an-Nagaf. I got recon photos. There're no troops there, no fighting--
answer: You don't know where the Iraqis have moved to. And our forces haven't even engaged the Republican Guard yet, we don't know--

question: It's about a hundred miles from where we are now. How long do you think it would take us to--
answer: It's not a hundred miles. It's a hundred miles through three different kinds of terrain

question: It's real. I'm telling you, it's real.
answer: So you just want to cross into hostile territory in the middle of a war on a wild goose chase? It's crazy. Tell him it's crazy, Epps. Epps, tell him. You're out of your minds, you know that? Both of you. You don't even know if there's anything out there. What the hell are you thinking?

question: This isn't funny, all right? I mean it.
answer: Hey, Wes, what kind of treasure you figure these people buried?

question: If! If there's a treasure.
answer: Yeah. If. Whatever. What kind you figure it is?

question: I don't know. It would be small, easy to transport and hide. Gold or jewels. Probably gold.
answer: Yeah! Gold! How much?

question: A car is not just a car where I come from. I had this friend, had this wicked candy apple red Sixty-four and a half Mustang--
answer: You're getting gold, and you're going to blow it on wheels?

question: What are you going to do with your third?
answer: Invest it.

question: Oh, that's fun.
answer: It's not about being fun. It's about being smart. You take that money, you take care of it, let it grow, and you don't ever have to do anything again. Ever. That's freedom. That's what I'm talking about.

question: And I'm talking about enjoying myself.
answer: You know, you sound just like a boy who's never--

question: Iraqis.
answer: Oh, God!

question: Two vehicles. They're not supposed to be here.
answer: Oh, Jesus!

question: We're going to keep driving.
answer: They'll shoot us!

question: We run they'll shoot us anyway. If we keep driving they might think we friendlies; Iraqis. Or even if they know we're Americans they might get scared, think we're part of a detachment and keep on going.
answer: They're not going to--

question: It's the only way. We drive! Wave at them. Don't look, just wave.
answer: Yeah! Yeah!

question: Go, go, go!
answer: Shoot them! Shoot 'em!

question: Steady it out!
answer: I steady it out, they blow us out of the sand!

question: I got him! You see that, I nailed him!
answer: Damn it! Wes, take the wheel. Take it! Keep it steady. Damn it! I said keep it steady.

question: Shoot...shoot! SHOOT! I thought we were dead.
answer: Yeah, well, we're not.

question: We got to get out of here. We have to go back.
answer: We're not going anywhere. Not 'til we get what we came for.

question: We just about got killed. You know what happened? We just about got killed, and you want to go on?
answer: Jaeger, go check out the Hummer for damage.

question: You're crazy, you know that? You're insane! You know that, right? You know he's sick?
answer: They shouldn't have been here.

question: We shouldn't have been here, Epps. There is a war going on!
answer: This is miles from the battle lines. They were probably deserters.

question: Deserters would have run, they wouldn't have engaged.
answer: They shouldn't have been out this way, that's all I'm saying.

question: We're not going back, are we? You bastard! You're trying to get us killed.
answer: I'm trying to get us paid. I'm trying to get us all paid! As long as there's a chance something is out there we go on. There's not going to be anymore trouble. If there is, we go back, but there won't be. You'll feel different after we find the treasure. Money has away of making people feel different. She okay?

question: What?
answer: I'm just thinking, you know, if the rest of the boys knew what we're doing. I mean if they knew what we were coming back with.

question: You can't tell anybody about this.
answer: I know. I know. But I'm saying, if they knew. We're going to be millionaires, man. Millionaires!

question: It'd make their heads explode.
answer: Millionaires, man. Ahh, there it is. There it is. You know it.

question: We leave it.
answer: What if someone takes it?

question: Who? Who's going to take it. We mark the location with the navicom, we can come right back to this spot.
answer: You two don't even know how crazy you are. You want to go on your sick, little treasure hunt then go ahead, but mark me absent.

question: You have to go with us, Wes.
answer: Really? What is that, an order, private?

question: You have to go with us. You can't walk back...
answer: Load what you can; water, tools, weapons. Anything you think we might need.

question: Who's he kidding? He wants it as bad as we do. We're going to be fat, Epps. As soon as we get back to Saudivillie you and me are going to--
answer: We're going to keep going 'cause I want some of whatever's out there. But you ever pull something like trying to get my ass stranded out here again, and I'll kill you myself. You got that? SAY IT!

question: Hey...hey! Slow up. You don't have to go so fast.
answer: Faster we get there, faster we get back.

question: Yeah. I know. I'm with you. I'm gonna...I'm just gonna stop for a little water.
answer: Don't drink up all of yours, 'cause you aren't getting any of ours.

question: I'm just going to have a little sip, that's all. Just a sip.
answer: You can catch up.

question: Thanks for straightening out Jaeger.
answer: Maybe we are crazy for doing this. But if we do it, we do it right. I just needed to explain that in a way I wouldn't have to do it again.

question: Not much chance of that. Jaeger's an idiot.
answer: He's not so--

question: He's an idiot, and he's not nearly as hard as he thinks.
answer: How tough you have to be to make the army? All you've got to do is shoot a gun, and stop a bullet.

question: Look at him. We ought to just leave him behind. Like he said
answer: Okay, so he was riding you. Get over it.

question: Can't even slow up for me. Wasn't for me they wouldn't even be here. I'm the one that found the map. Should have just come by myself. Should've. Shouldn't even cut them in. Shouldn't. Epps... Epps!
answer: What!?

question: Mine.
answer: What?

question: Mine. Land mine! I stepped on a land mine!
answer: You didn't step on any mine.

question: I heard it click.
answer: If you stepped on a mine you'd be dead by now. Nobody uses delayed-fuse mines anymore.

question: JESUS CHRIST, I'M STANDING ON A MINE. SHUT UP, AND GET OVER HERE!
answer: Paranoid, that's your problem. You're just paranoid. Why'd the paranoid one have to find the map?

question: Oh, God! Oh God!
answer: Just be cool.

question: It's a mine, isn't it?
answer: Just relax.

question: How'm I gonna relax standing on a mine!?
answer: We're going to get off, all right. We'll get you off of there. Just...be cool.

question: Where you going?
answer: Me and Wes are just going to talk.

question: Why you got to move away to talk!?
answer: We're going to be right over here.

question: You're moving away because it's going to blow up, isn't it!? It's going to blow up!
answer: I said be cool, all right? Now be cool!

question: I said be cool, all right? Now be cool!
answer: What kind of mine?

question: I don't know, and I wasn't about to mess with it.
answer: Should have blown already. Delayed fuse, that's Vietnam stuff.

question: Break it out.
answer: My leg is falling asleep.

question: It's not falling asleep. You've only been standing there for three minutes.
answer: I'm the one who can feel my leg, and it's falling asleep.

question: It falls asleep and you die, so wake it the hell up.
answer: How's this going to work?

question: Me and Wes each going take an end of the rope, run our asses of, and yank you off the mine.
answer: That's going to do it, right? I'm going to be okay.

question: You're going to be fine.
answer: You're not going to let me die, are you!? Don't let me die!

question: When we start running suck up your breath. You're going to get the wind knocked out of you.
answer: Don't let me die, Epps. I don't want to die.

question: What if it's a Valloro 69? Just going to bounce right up out of the ground, explode in the air, kill him and us.
answer: You just go when I say go.

question: Should have at least gotten the map off of him. Blows up with him then we did all this for nothing.
answer: Ready?

question: Yeah.
answer: GO!

question: How long we going to keep this up.
answer: Until we're out of the mine field is how long.

question: Haven't found a mine for half a mile, or more.
answer: That don't mean nothing. Iraqis could have just spread them out like that; make us think we're in the clear.

question: You want to crawl, crawl.
answer: You're going to blow yourselves up.

question: You're going to blow yourselves up.
answer: Wes is right. If there were any more mines we would have found them. Hell, that one you stepped on was probably old anyway; left over from the war with Iran.

question: You don't know that. It could be a trick.
answer: If we step on a mine we'll know it was. Let me see the maps. Get up and give me the maps. We're on course. Northeast, twenty-eight degrees. When we hit the base of the mountain we'll find a pass. I can see it on the recon photo. Shouldn't be too hard to traverse. That'll take us to the top and... This. Whatever it is.

question: What is it?
answer: Iraqis. A bunch of them.

question: What are they doing here?
answer: Well, it's Iraq. I'm not sure, but I'm guessing that has something to do with them being here.

question: So good bye, Shi'ites. Thanks for playing. We have some lovely parting gifts for you as you go.
answer: We're American soldiers. We don't abandon people.

question: Funny you should say that while we're out looking for gold.
answer: You're the one wanted to kill Iraqis so bad.

question: All we've got to do is make it to the top.
answer: And find the treasure, and get it, and get back to the Humvee, and get the hell out of Iraqi without getting our heads blown off, but that's about it.

question: We're not going to find anything standing here. Let's get to climbing. Not much of a pass.
answer: Probably was a couple of hundred years ago when whoever drew the map came through here. Worn down to nothing now.

question: We make it, or we go back empty handed.
answer: Looks like we make it.

question: The US Army
answer: Let me see the map. Should be easy going from here. Stay on the pass straight to the dot.

question: What do you figure it to be?
answer: Got to be some kind of landmark; something distinctive.

question: Got to be some kind of landmark; something distinctive.
answer: X marks the spot.

question: Something like that.
answer: But the white dot in the middle; that's got to mean something.

question: I hope it means something, otherwise...
answer: Otherwise whatever we're looking for could be anywhere.

question: Basically. But the map has been pretty precise so far. I don't think it'll be too hard to-- Take cover! Let's hit 'em! Cover me. Clear.
answer: Where'd they go?

question: I don't know. There's a lot of space up here. They could be just about--
answer: Weird they didn't chase us.

question: What's weird is how they disappeared. Doesn't make sense. Doesn't... Scatter!
answer: Where is it? Where'd it go?

question: Stay low.
answer: Where the hell is it!?

question: Just stay down.
answer: What are we going to do? What the hell are we going to do?

question: We're not going to do anything.
answer: They're going to kill us!

question: What are you doing?
answer: What does it look like I'm doing?

question: It looks like you're not doing anything.
answer: I'm not. And I'm not doing anything, because there's nothing down here.

question: Get up and dig.
answer: We've been digging. We've been digging for hours. If there was anything here to find we would have found it.

question: Get up off your ass and dig!
answer: What's the point? There's nothing here. The map's a fake. Christ, even I see that now. We're just wasting our time. We might as well give up and--

question: Must be a compartment.
answer: I feel air. Probably opens up outside somewhere. That's where the light comes from. Couldn't see it with the lanternon.

question: The white dot; light in the dark. Maybe we should blast it loose with the claymore.
answer: It's giving.

question: Jesus Christ!
answer: No, don't shoot! It's just a mongoose.

question: Is it dead?
answer: Yeah, Bwana, you got it.

question: Wait.
answer: What? What?

question: We send the gold up what's to stop him from taking off and leaving us down here?
answer: He's not going to leave us.

question: All right. I'll go up, then you send up the gold and--
answer: Why do I have to stay down here?

question: Jesus, Jaeger.
answer: I don't see how that plan's any better.

question: All right. You go up, I'll send up the gold, then follow.
answer: Yeah. Yeah, that'll work.

question: If you're even thinking about leaving me down here, you better think again.
answer: Wes, I'm coming up.

question: Okay! Wes? Jaeger? Jaeger? Jaeger!? What the hell took so long.
answer: Just had to get the pack unhooked from the line. It didn't seem that long.

question: Not when you're up here with the gold, I guess not.
answer: Not losing trust, are you?

question: It'll be too dark to make our way back now. Let's bed down for the night and head out at first light.
answer: What about the gold?

question: What about it?
answer: Maybe we should split it up now.

question: We started this together, and we're staying together, so there's no point in splitting things up now.
answer: What if we get separated? Way I see it if something happens I want to be carrying my share.

question: It stays as it is. We're halfway home now. Let's not blow it by people getting ideas.
answer: You're the one with all the ideas.

question: You've had your say, Wes. Now leave it.
answer: Maybe you've got ideas of your own for the gold. Maybe you've already got things worked out.

question: Maybe I do.
answer: Maybe I don't need your ideas. Maybe I can do better on my own. You got no reason to do that!

question: I caught him! I caught him trying to steal the gold.
answer: Get off him.

question: He snuck in here thinking we were asleep, only I wasn't sleeping. Would have slit our throats if I hadn't stopped him.
answer: Get off him! What happened?

question: He's a soldier. He doesn't need a weapon. He's got rocks. He's got bare hands. Shut up!
answer: Stop it!

question: I told you; don't push me around.
answer: Tell me what he's saying.

question: Says they were deserters, they were afraid to fight, don't believe in Saddam anyway. They flew the gunship up here to hide out. When they saw us they figured we were going to kill them, so they shot first.
answer: Why'd he come in our camp.

question: Says he wanted food. Liar. He wanted the gold.
answer: How's he going to want the gold? He couldn't even know we had it.

question: He...he could have been watching us.
answer: Maybe we should give him some water.

question: All last night he could have been--
answer: I think he wants something to drink.

question: I'm not wasting my water on him. I don't care what he says, he wanted our gold. Would have slit our throats if he had the chance.
answer: Doesn't matter. Whatever he wanted he didn't get it. We've got no need staying around here. It's light enough. Let's pack up and head out.

question: What about him? We...we have to do something. We can't just leave him. He'll run back to his outfit, report our position...
answer: You said he was a deserter.

question: That's what he says. He could be a spy, or something.
answer: You don't know that.

question: He'd just slow us down, and drink our water. And if we ran into any more Iraqis you know he'd sell us out.
answer: We don't leave him, we don't take him with us. What does that leave? You're out of your mind.

question: He's an enemy soldier.
answer: I'm not going to let you kill him.

question: We're at war.
answer: We are not at war! You and I and Jaeger are AWOL. We have no authority--

question: I'm not going to leave him be just so he can stab us in the backs the minute we turn around. I have been through too much to lose it all now just because the two of you don't have the stomach to do what has to be done.
answer: I've got no stomach for murder.

question: It's a combat action.
answer: It's murder, and I won't be any part of it.

question: Then step aside.
answer: No.

question: We should head Northeast.
answer: Northeast? That's away from the Hummer; further into Iraqi.

question: There's another pass on the photo. We can avoid that narrow one we had to cross on the way up, and it should get us back down.
answer: It should, or it will? Least going back the way we came we know what we're up against.

question: You think you can make that pass weighted down when you almost fell the first time you're wrong, and you're not going to take my share of the gold with you trying it. We're heading Northeast.
answer: You've got an awful lot of orders in you. Always giving orders.

question: I out rank you, that's why.
answer: In the service you do, but we're not particularly in the service right now. Way I see it, what we're doing, that doesn't particularly give you the right to toss orders around.

question: We been down this road. I told you how it is. Unless you feel like there's something you want to do about it...
answer: What if I do? What if I do? You talk loud, and don't even have a big stick to back it up with.

question: What the hell...? Help! Help me! Help me! For Christ's Sake, Jaeger! Help me! Help me!
answer: Wes...Wes!

question: The navicom!
answer: What are we going to do? How are we going to find our way back!?

question: We'll find our way.
answer: How!?

question: We'll find our way! We'll...
answer: No navicom. A lot of good you are now, Epps.

question: Lot of good you were when I was sinking in the sand.
answer: Without that navicam looks to me like you forfeit the right to be in charge.

question: And let me guess who is.
answer: I'm the one's got the big stick.

question: Suppose I don't go for that?
answer: Then I suppose it'd be insurrection, and I suppose I'd have to kill you. I suppose.

question: What about Jaeger?
answer: Nothing about him, unless he's got a problem about me dealing with you.

question: We got to go back. We got to go back for Wes.
answer: Forget Wes.

question: We can't just leave him.
answer: Wes is dead!

question: What if he's not?
answer: Then he will be when those Iraqis get to him. He was going to kill you. He was one blink away from it. He's dead, Epps, and I'm sure as hell not getting my head blow off over his carcass. It's a helicopter.

question: Ours, or theirs? Ours, or theirs?
answer: Ours. It's one of ours. We've got to signal them; let them know we're down here.

question: No.
answer: We need something

question: No.
answer: What do you mean no? They can fly us home.

question: They'll ask questions; want to know why we were out here.
answer: We'll lie.

question: They'll search the pack. They'll find the gold.
answer: We're lost, you understand that? We've got no navicom, and no means to find a way back. So right now I don't give a damn about the gold because if we don't get off this desert, and out of Iraqi all it's going to be good for is buying us tombstones.

question: I can't do it, Epps. Not when we're so close. I can't let you ruin everything.
answer: First Wes, now you?

question: I'm not like Wes. Wes was crazy.
answer: And you; you've got it all together.

question: I don't want it this way. I wouldn't kill you just to kill you, but I can't let you lose the gold for me. Not when we're so close.
answer: That helicopter passes, and the only thing we're close to is death.

question: Sit down, Epps. I'm sorry about that, Epps.
answer: Is it all right if I stand up?

question: Oh, yeah. Go ahead. I'm glad I didn't have to kill you. I'm glad it didn't come to that.
answer: Yeah. Well, me too.

question: I never killed anybody before. I talk a good game, but I'm not like that.
answer: Sure.

question: Really, I'm not. Remember how I was talking I wanted to blow away all those Iraqis? That's all it was was talk. I was scared out of my mind to go to war. I still haven't gotten over stepping on that land mine.
answer: You still got a map on you?

question: What? Yeah. Epps?
answer: Yeah.

question: I don't want to die.
answer: Makes two of us.

question: I know what I did just now was crazy, but you got to understand how much I want that gold.
answer: It's all right. I don't like it, but it's over now.

question: I never had anything before, Epps. I never was anybody. Not the kind of somebody you can be with a pocket full of gold coins. When I was in high school I used to--
answer: Hey, you know what? Can I be honest with you? Right now I'm not all that interested in how you're messed up 'cause you didn't get the bicycle you wanted for your thirteenth birthday. What I'm interested in is how I can keep from getting dead. And listening to sob stories from some about how the system wasn't good to him because he had to work like everybody else instead of being born a Kennedy doesn't do a damn thing to help keep me alive. So do me a favor; either shut up, or...just shut up.

question: Sorry.
answer: Damn.

question: What do you think our chances are?
answer: If we can find the Hummer, or some friendlies by sundown we might be okay. We've got enough water for that. But we won't make another day otherwise.

question: Wonder how the war's going?
answer: It's got to be going better than this.. We can't just sit here. We've got to start moving, so pick.

question: You sure you want me too? I pick that way.
answer: Okay. Then we go this way.

question: Getting cold.
answer: It's a desert. That's what deserts do at night; they get cold.

question: Epps...Epps! I'm gonna stop for a second.
answer: No!

question: Just let me rest for a second.
answer: We've got to keep moving while there's still light.

question: You know what I'm going to do? I'm just going to take a second. I want to look at the gold.
answer: Don't you touch it.

question: I just want to look at it. Remind me of what I'm dying for.
answer: The deal was no one touches it until we get out of here.

question: Yeah, but we made that deal while Wes was still alive. He's gone. Time for a new deal.
answer: You listen to me. If, if we get out of this I don't care what you do with your share, but until then you've only got one thing to think about and that's staying alive. So you leave that gold alone, or you and I are going to have to have a serious talk.

question: Look. What do you figure it is?
answer: Place all alone like that? Must be a boarder check point.

question: Which boarder? Saudi? Kuwait? Syria?
answer: Couldn't be Syria. We couldn't have gone that far north. It's got to be Saudi. Come on.

question: Epps.
answer: We can head back for our lines, and they don't even have to know about the gold.

question: Epps. What if they're not Saudi. If it's a checkpoint, it could be Iraqi.
answer: We've got no cboice. Either way, we've got no choice.

question: Well?
answer: Well, we should identify ourselves.

question: Yeah, I guess we should.
answer: Even if they are Iraqis probably all they'll do is take us prisoner for awhile. Got to figure we're still kicking their asses in the war. They don't want any trouble.

question: Hell, they'll probably just surrender to us. Probably.
answer: That's if the war is even still going on. Way things were shaping up it's probably long over.

question: Probably.
answer: Hellooooo--

question: Ashra Ka mahari dahra sahib! Ashra Ka mahari dahra sahib!
answer: What did you say?

question: I don't know. Something Wes had taught me. I think it means "Don't shoot. We're your friends."
answer: They must be Saudis. It's a Saudi checkpoint. Oh sweet, Jesus. Come on. Come on!

question: Oh, God...
answer: They must have thought we were Iraqi when you yelled to them. They couldn't tell in the dark.

question: What are we going to do?
answer: Slip out your M-16.

question: And then what?
answer: And then shoot them.

question: I...I never killed anyone before. I told you that.
answer: Well, you're going to start with a bang, 'cause you've got four of them to take down.

question: Can't you--
answer: I don't have a weapon. Don't go bitch on me now! You were going to kill me. Kill them!

question: I just said I would. I don't think I--
answer: Shoot them! Shoot them, Jaeger! SHOOT THEM! Let's get some sleep.

question: Nothing.
answer: What do we do?

question: We can't stay here. Even if that wasn't an Iraqi soldier it's only a matter of time before some show up. Get all the water you can carry, and we'll head out on foot.
answer: To where?

question: Sun rises in the East. We go the opposite direction. May not find anything, but at least we'll know we're heading towards Saudi Arabia. Ready?
answer: Look! What do we do?

question: We keep going, that's what we do. We ignore them, maybe they ignore us.
answer: Jesus! How many of them are there?

question: I don't like this. Let's go.
answer: What do you make of them?

question: Shi'ites, I think.
answer: Is that good, or bad?

question: I don't know. They killed Wes.
answer: Why haven't they killed us!?

question: I don't know!
answer: ...Maybe...maybe we can fight our way out.

question: With what? Against how many?
answer: We can't just sit here waiting to die.

question: You come up with a better plan, let me know.
answer: Maybe...maybe if we traded them the gold. If we gave it to them they might let us live; they might not kill us.

question: ...Wes...?
answer: You were shot. We were standing right there, you were shot!

question: You actually got around to killing someone. I'm impressed. I guess you're only half a bitch.
answer: Wes, we thought you were dead, and we thought we were next. Hanging around to get killed wouldn't have done anyone any good.

question: Sure, and I guess it was just convenient there was one less person to split the gold with.
answer: Wes--

question: Look, I know you guys are telling the truth. It's just the Shi'ites don't know that. I guess you could tell them...but then you don't speak the language do you? Thanks for taking care of this for me.
answer: Tell me something, Wes. Are you crazy, greedy, or just stupid? Jaeger says you're crazy.

question: Me? I say you don't have enough brains to be stupid.
answer: You disappoint me, Epps. Always figured you to be a man; a real bright guy. I had respect for you.

question: That why you tried to put a bullet in my head in the middle of the desert.
answer: That's just what things came to. Sometimes you can't help that. It doesn't change me respecting you. And now you let me down. I expected more from you, you know? I really did. I expected you to--

question: You expect this? Get the gold! Now let's try things another way. Let's try this I'll take that as a yes. Get the water.
answer: They'll kill you. You won't make it ten feet before they cut you down.

question: No, but I figure now's a real good time to start. Don't say anything. Just keep quiet.
answer: I have to answer him.

question: So you can give us away?
answer: If I don't answer, he'll know something's up.

question: You answer him, but you answer him wrong and you're going to be staring at your insides while you're dying. Bastard!
answer: Stop them!

question: We go this way. Jaeger!
answer: The gold; give it to me. Give it to me!

question: If I give it to you, will you let us go?
answer: Sure. Whatever you want. For old time sake. Looks like at the end of the day we finally find out who's better than who, don't we, Epps? Like I said; I expected more from you.

question: It's like I said; you don't really know lieutenant John Epps very well, do you? Damn it. We lost the horses.
answer: The...the gold...

question: It wasn't the gold. It was the claymore mine. The gold's in my pack.
answer: When did you make the switch?

question: It's always been like that. When you left me down in the crevice to send the gold up I figured I'd better...take precautions. I rigged it to blow if anyone opened the pack. Just in case somebody thought they could do better on their own.
answer: But...

question: We had a deal. No one touches the gold until we're out of here. No one breaks the deal, no one had anything to worry about.
answer: What if it hadn't been Wes? What if...I mean, accidently, what if I had...

question: Well?
answer: A car's got to come along sooner or later. When it does, we jack it.

question: How do we do that?
answer: You lie in the middle of the road, look like you're hurt. When the car stops I run over to the driver and put a gun to his head.

question: Why do I have to lie in the road?
answer: Somebody has to.

question: Yeah, but why me? What if the car doesn't stop?
answer: Then I'm a rich man.

question: Epps.
answer: Yeah.

question: I want you to know... I don't know. I just think you're a hell of a guy.
answer: Thanks.

question: This whole time, you've kept your head. You didn't go money simple like me and Wes. You've just been trying to figure how to get us out of here. And you've been fair too. I mean, even after I...you know...
answer: Threatened to blow my brains out?

question: Yeah. Even after that. You didn't take it out on me, except for maybe making me lie in the middle of the road now. But I'd say you've been very fair. I just think it's a hell of a man who can keep from going money simple.
answer: Don't make so much out of it. Only reason I haven't figured a way to get all that money for myself is because I've been too busy figuring ways to stay alive. Believe me; if I had a minute to catch my breath I might have played things the way you and Wes had. I'm no better than anybody else. I've just been busier.

question: Epps?
answer: What?

question: I'm thinking about taking a trip.
answer: Thought you were going to buy a car.

question: Still am. There's more gold than I thought, and since there's only two of us now... Where should I go?
answer: I don't know.

question: I've never been anywhere. I wouldn't know where to go. Where would you go?
answer: How the hell should I know? Australia.

question: What?
answer: I'd go to Australia. Lot of land, not many people. I think after this I'd like to quit people for awhile. And the girls go crazy for brothers down there.

question: Really?
answer: That's what I hear. Don't matter. Girls go crazy everywhere for a man with gold.

question: Well, this is it. We get the car, find some Americans. We find Americans we'll be all right.
answer: We'll make up some kind of lie. They won't find the gold.

question: Okay. See you in a minute. Epps, I don't think he's slowing down.
answer: He'll slow down.

question: He's not slowing.
answer: He's going to slow down.

question: Epps...Epps! Aw, damn!
answer: You speak English? DO YOU SPEAK ENGLISH!?

question: You speak English? DO YOU SPEAK ENGLISH!?
answer: Y-yes.

question: Where were you going?
answer: Baghdad.

question: What's in the other direction?
answer: This road, it leads straight to Kuwait.

question: Turn the car around.
answer: Please, I beg of you. The American army is there. I am Iraqi. They will kill me.

question: Nobody's going to hurt you. You see that? Gold. You take us to the Americans, and we'll give you another one. Now drive.
answer: You are Americans, yes? We didn't not all want this war, do you know? We didn't not all want to invade our brothers and sisters in Kuwait. Now your army crushes us. So few days, and so many have died. And many fear we will all die. Please tell this to your people I have a brother in our army. When I take you back, will you look for him? If he is still alive, will you look for him and take care of him?
